intro: Racosperma spirorbe, commonly known as the spiral-leaf acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant has slender, often spirally arranged leaves that give it its common name. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Racosperma spirorbe is valued for its ornamental appearance and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
